newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy Antitrust financial svcs probe ready by Nov.
newsitem.headline: Italy Antitrust financial svcs probe ready by Nov.

text.p: Italy's Antitrust authority will complete an inquiry into the country's financial services sector by November, chairman Giuliano Amato said.

"The investigation is nearly finished and the current authority wants to complete it before its term expires (in November)," Amato told a news conference after delivering the body's annual report to parliament.
In the report, Amato called for initiatives to boost competition in the sector such as measures evening out fiscal treatment of risk capital and loan capital.

Referring to banks in particular, "the major strategic challenge" they had to face up to in the near term was that of choosing a specialisation and a range of services to offer within a context of seeking greater profitability, he said.
This was necessary, Amato added, because the globalisation of markets meant that already meagre profit margins would tend to get even tighter.
